perturbation.original_text: By this Agreement the Members enter into a joint venture (the “Venture”) in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida. The rights and obligations of the Members will be as stated in the applicable legislation of the State of Florida (the “Act”) except as otherwise provided here.
perturbation.changed_text: By this Agreement the Members enter into a joint venture (the “Venture”) in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware. The rights and obligations of the Members will be determined solely by this Agreement, irrespective of Delaware law.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract specifies Florida law. Changing it to Delaware law while simultaneously stating the agreement supersedes Delaware law creates a direct contradiction. This misalignment makes it unclear which jurisdiction and legal standards govern the joint venture, leading to potential enforcement issues.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Joint Venture Law and Delaware Joint Venture Law

perturbation.original_text: Accurate and complete books of account of the transactions of the Venture will be kept in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and at all reasonable times will be available and open to inspection and examination by any Member. The books and records of the Venture will reflect all the Venture’s transactions and will be appropriate and adequate for the business conducted by the Venture.
perturbation.changed_text: Books of account will be kept at the discretion of the Managers. Access to these books will be permitted only upon unanimous consent of all Members and Managers. The books and records will reflect transactions that the Managers deem relevant.
perturbation.explanation: This modification directly contradicts the generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) requirements. GAAP mandates transparency and consistency in financial record-keeping, whereas the modified clause introduces managerial discretion and restricts access, leading to potential legal challenges regarding financial transparency and accountability.

perturbation.original_text: Any management vote required will be determined such that each Manager receives one vote carrying equal weight.
perturbation.changed_text: Any management vote required will be determined such that Manager Aaldo PIscitello receives 75% of the total vote, while Manager Jody Stewart receives 25% of the total vote.
perturbation.explanation: This modification contradicts the initial agreement of equal voting weight between managers. This change introduces an unequal power dynamic that could be challenged based on fairness and fiduciary duty principles, creating ambiguity in the validity of management decisions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of Equal Partnership and Fiduciary Duty
